CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Wooden Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Wooden bullets that are not able to stay in one piece after exiting the barrel.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Stone Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Stone bullets that are not able to stay in one piece after exiting the barrel they fragmet less than wood though.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Silver Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Silver Musket balls that are okay at penetrating armor but are rather costly for that purpouse.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Gold Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Gold Musket Ball only made and used in desperation if there is nothing else, high damage through flesh as the soft metal spreads out though.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Uranium Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Uranium Musket Ball that has the best armor penetration it's low speed caused the bullet to be lodged into the body however and some of it dissolves into the blood and it may cause cancer.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Steel Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Steel Musket Ball, standard good armor penetration not very costly.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Plasteel Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Plasteel Musket Ball, second best in armor penetration and good damage, not very common though.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Infectious Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Infectious Musket Ball filled with all sorts of nastiness, It's low armor penetration makes it good against unarmored targets.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Incendiary Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Incendiary Musket Ball filled with Prometheum, It's able to start significant fires.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: High Explosive Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: exploding musket ball that does little explosive damage, But could spray fragments about the place.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Square Musket Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Square Musket Ball, seemingly ridiculous but with increased damage but poor armor penetration.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Illumination Round
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Illumination Round That is able to light a large area to almost daylight conditions.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Steel Cannon Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Steel Cannon Ball, standard good armor penetration, not very costly.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Bi-Metal Cannon Ball
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: Bi-Metal Cannon Ball, great armor penetration, could take out centipides, rather costly.

CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.label: Low velocity High Explosive
CombatExtended.AmmoCategoryDef.description: These Low Velocity High Explosive Shells are usually used in seiges or for lobbing shells over walls and structures
